Package ca.concordia.patterns.command

Class Advance

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.concordia.patterns.command.Advance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Order
    public class Advance
extends java.lang.Object
implements Order
    Move some armies from one of the current playerâ€™s territories (source) to an adjacent territory (target). If the target territory belongs to the current player, the armies are moved to the target territory. If the target territory belongs to another player, an attack happens between the two territories.

    Command Syntax: Advance order command: advance countrynamefrom countynameto numarmies

    This class implements interface "Order", so as to use execute(), valid(), printOrder() methods

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Advance​(Player p_Initiator, Territory p_Source, Territory p_Target, int p_Num)
      This is the constructor that takes player, source and target territory object and no of armies as argument encapsulating all necessary data to execute the command

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void execute()
      execute method executes the Advance card after validity check move some armies from one of the current playerâ€™s territories (source) to an adjacent territory (target).
      void printOrder()
      This method will print all the commands that have been executed and the log for which have been saved in log file
      boolean valid()
      This method will check if the given inputs are a valid input for Advance Card check if countrynamefrom exists check if countryname has the same owner as the d_Initiator of this commad check if countrynamefrom has greater than or equal to numarmies being advanced..

      • Advance

        public Advance​(Player p_Initiator,
               Territory p_Source,
               Territory p_Target,
               int p_Num)
        This is the constructor that takes player, source and target territory object and no of armies as argument encapsulating all necessary data to execute the command
        Parameters:
        p_Initiator - player who runs the command
        p_Source - Source territory form which armies are to be moved
        p_Target - target territory to which armies are to be attacked
        p_Num - no of armies attacking

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        execute method executes the Advance card after validity check move some armies from one of the current playerâ€™s territories (source) to an adjacent territory (target). If the target territory belongs to the current player, the armies are moved to the target territory. If the target territory belongs to another player, an attack happens between the two territories. If attack happens successfully, update owner to d_Initiator Here both the source and the target Territories are Receivers
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Order

      • valid

        public boolean valid()
        This method will check if the given inputs are a valid input for Advance Card check if countrynamefrom exists check if countryname has the same owner as the d_Initiator of this commad check if countrynamefrom has greater than or equal to numarmies being advanced.. check if countrynameto is there check if countrynameto exists
        Specified by:
        valid in interface Order
        Returns:
        true/false

      • printOrder

        public void printOrder()
        This method will print all the commands that have been executed and the log for which have been saved in log file
